website_summaries.verdict: A large variety of seeds, bonus accessories, excellent customer service, and reasonably high germination rates adds to the exceptional value of this product.
pros: Provides an impressive variety of non-GMO seeds
40 individual packets total 16,500 heirloom vegetable seeds
Plant trimming scissors and growing instructional booklet included

customer_reviews.title: Customer Service is Incredible
customer_reviews.text: I couldn't get ANY of the seeds I bought to germinate. I used 4 different soil mixes under 3 different conditions and nothing at all. I emailed to see if they had any suggestions, and they sent me a whole new set. I had about a 95% germination rate with the second set under each condition and with each soil type. I even sowed some directly and now have lettuce, soinach, and zucchini growing. I'm not sure if there was a seed storage issue or what, but the customer service alone was worth taking the risk of purchasing.
customer_reviews.author: Lauren M.

customer_reviews.title: Missing seeds
customer_reviews.text: Many of the seeds listed on the package and in the item description was not in the package we received. Several had different quantities and a few were included that were not listed. Overall very dissatisfied that many of the seeds we were looking forward to using were missing.
customer_reviews.author: Customer_01

customer_reviews.title: Love My Garden because of these seeds!
customer_reviews.text: I'm happy with these seeds and had a lovely vegetable garden last year. While the direction did state to germinate indoors, we planted the seeds directly into our garden boxes outside with wonderful results. We did get some duplicates and also had some missing strains, however when I alerted the company regarding this the response was immediate. I received the missing seeds in days. Great product and great service. I posted some pictures of my garden from seed to harvest. What more can you ask for? These are a bargain at the current price.
customer_reviews.author: DWest

customer_reviews.title: Don't waste your money
customer_reviews.text: Don't waste your money. Only about 20% of the seeds germinated, and the ones that did survive barely produced. I have done sustainable gardening for 15 years. I usually can about 900 jars every year..with these seeds, i didnt get enough to can a single jar.
customer_reviews.author: Abbie Steil

customer_reviews.title: Is this a joke?
customer_reviews.text: I did not receive any of the items I was supposed to. Got catnip and a bunch of other herbs instead. Would not recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Mud

customer_reviews.title: MANY SEED PACKETS COMPLETELY EMPTY.
customer_reviews.text: Save your money. Many of the seed packets were completely empty and packaged with air. I am so disappointed. I suggest spending a little extra and going with the competitors variety that come in clear resealable Mylar bags.
customer_reviews.author: Sam Cee

customer_reviews.title: Highly Recommended
customer_reviews.text: Unheard of customer service from these guys here! I had a couple missing strains in my first ordered batch, and before I could barely get a dissatisfactory thought of the company, a package arrived containing those missing and many extras as well!! Have already planted many varieties now and the seeds are all germinating fantastically!
customer_reviews.author: A Milluh

customer_reviews.title: Missing many of the important seeds
customer_reviews.text: All the important seeds for which I bought the pack for as missing. What I wanted but are missing: - American flag leek - Chives - Cucumber(Ashley,Boston Pickling) - Endive, Black Eye - Tomato(Ace 55, Purple Beauty, Roma, Jubilee) They are only including cheap seeds you can buy elsewhere for pennies.
customer_reviews.author: B. B.

customer_reviews.title: Very useful vegetable seeds
customer_reviews.text: Started nearly half the varieties in the pack. Used 2-4 seeds per cup, that was too much, had to thin them they all sprouted. Everything was well packaged and labelled. It was very convenient to purchase a variety pack like this instead of individual packets from the nursery, more economical too. Just taped the small seed packets shut after opening in order to save seeds for future use. The zucchini was subbed with summer squash, everything else was as listed. Will update as the garden grows. Very satisfied with this variety seed pack, highly recommended, and would purchase from this company again. Thank You.
customer_reviews.author: Laurel

customer_reviews.title: honest review
customer_reviews.text: Ordered a kit like this last year and almost everything grew. Ordered this one and almost nothing grew. Went to dollar store and bought bargain seed packs and they all grew. Don't know what happened but my batch of seeds were a waste.
customer_reviews.author: edmocon

customer_reviews.title: bad packaging & germination
customer_reviews.text: I was initially excited to receive this wide assortment of seeds. However, first issue was that they're all wrapped in little packets that are hard to open and then unresealable--thus difficult to manage what you don't use. Then I had very poor germination rate of the seeds once planted.
customer_reviews.author: David Radcliff

customer_reviews.title: No germination.
customer_reviews.text: None of my seeds germinated. Super sad since this happened with both veggies and herb seed packages.
customer_reviews.author: Aj

customer_reviews.title: Wasted my time planting them
customer_reviews.text: The seeds that germinated were the zucchini. Everything else was a flop. Wasted my time planting them.
customer_reviews.author: Lucy B.

customer_reviews.title: Made in USA and NON-GMO!
customer_reviews.text: Made in USA was a plus to us. Excited to have such a huge variety. Heirloom strains make me more confident that we'll be able to harvest what we plant. Pleases us to have such diversity. You can't beat 100% money back guarantee either. Chemical free is important, especially since our grandchildren will be eating our vegetables. We appreciate not only having the general name of vegetables listed, but the specific name as well. We have our garden in large containers, to make it easy for me to sit when I need to. Using these seeds will allow me to easily rotate crops to protect our soil. Couldn't be happier with the purchase. Instructions are inside the pack.
customer_reviews.author: T. Hattaway

customer_reviews.title: Not recommended
customer_reviews.text: Price to seed ratio is highway robbery for a 10% germination rate.
customer_reviews.author: Donna Padgett

customer_reviews.title: 0% Germination
customer_reviews.text: 0% germination rate. I’ve tried four different times, in a greenhouse and in my indoor seedling room, with heating mat, lights, sterile pots and new seed starting medium. Worst seed buy I’ve ever made.
customer_reviews.author: jenifer brandenburg

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: I was incredibly excited to find these and purchase them. However, I planted them inside to start them in my indoor planter box, near my sliding glass door. I planted most of the varieties and I ended up only getting 3 seeds that took. One yellow onion and 2 butter crunch lettuce. Very disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Faith

customer_reviews.title: Missing packets, lots of filler.
customer_reviews.text: I am missing multiple seed packets and have recieved lots of extra packets as well. Ordered herb packet and received an additional vegetable packet instead with the same contents of the last. Very disappointing.
customer_reviews.author: Erin Flory

customer_reviews.title: The seats don’t germinate
customer_reviews.text: I was surprised to find that the seeds in this pack were not really good. Most of them never germinated. I was very disappointed. This is not a product I would recommend for someone to buy.
customer_reviews.author: MARIA  BRICETTE

customer_reviews.title: Helpful Customer Service
customer_reviews.text: Only received half the variety of seeds indicated and some that weren’t even on the package. Would have liked one pack of squash or eggplant instead of 5 packs of rhubarb and 2 packs of lavender. **** Update ***** I contacted customer service and they replaced the missing seeds. What I’ve planted so far seems to be growing well.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: bunch of the packets were empty
customer_reviews.text: I dont know if there is a problem with your packaging machine or what but a bunch of the packets were empty air. No seeds in them. The packages were sealed closed and when when I went to open them I realized they were empty with no seeds in them. I would not recommend anyone buy this because who knows if you'll get seeds or not. Really disappointed. I didnt know to check when I first got them. I kept the main package sealed because I thought they would last longer. Never making that mistake again.
customer_reviews.author: drew

customer_reviews.title: Mystery grab bag, buyer BEWARE!
customer_reviews.text: Held my order back over a MONTH! When it finally shows up, it was missing several KEY items! List of missing items: Honeydew melon, peas, rhubarb, rutabaga, watermelon, cayenne pepper, red romaine lettuce. Replacements: leek, mustard, dill, parsley, chives. Obviously this company has ZERO knowledge or concern about overall the nutritional value of the product they are trying to persuade people as a "SURVIVAL SEED GARDEN"! Its a mystery grab bag folks, that's what you are buying here!
customer_reviews.author: KC James Brown

customer_reviews.title: Missing Seed Packets
customer_reviews.text: Make sure to check which and how many seed packets you get. Mine had several duplicates and missing seed varieties. The seeds I did get in my package seem to be quality and easy to germinate.
customer_reviews.author: Ray Miller

customer_reviews.title: Crap seeds
customer_reviews.text: Most of the seed packets barely had three, four seeds. Nothing sprouted. Wasted money and a growing season.
customer_reviews.author: stacey harvey

customer_reviews.title: Seeds varieties are different than advertised
customer_reviews.text: Pepper: serrano instead of sweet yolo wonder Squash: summer instead of black beauty zucchini Peas: blackeye cowpea instead of green arrow.
customer_reviews.author: Tyler Schaeffer

customer_reviews.title: end hunger
customer_reviews.text: Dear Sir: I buy the seeds to help food banks so that we can feed the homeless and to help end starvation. I buy the seeds to help smaller food banks feed more people. I have had no negative responses because the seeds sprout as expected with produce enough to help the food banks continue giving the produce to people in need. The seeds are also given to people starting community gardens. The price of the seeds is still budget friendly so I will continue purchasing them. Dee Richards
customer_reviews.author: Dee Richard's

customer_reviews.title: Most of what I've planted is okay, but...
customer_reviews.text: Updated Review 07/09/17: 3/5 stars. Cucumber and pea packets were completely empty when I went to go plant the seeds. The packets were sealed and appeared just fine from the outside, but when I opened them, they were empty. There were no romaine lettuce seeds in the package even though they're listed on the outside of it. Banana pepper seeds never germinated, and only about 30% of the carrots grew. Everything else I've planted seems to be doing just fine. 03/18/17: Seems okay, can't wait to plant my garden!
customer_reviews.author: TAE

customer_reviews.title: Good value great packaging
customer_reviews.text: Pros... I received quickly. Packaging was good. Seed packs were clearly labeled. Actually received extra packets of a few variety of seeds. Growers quick reference included. Cannot buy this many heirloom seeds for this price Great value. Cons. My only complaint is that with the larger seeds such as pumpkin and Corn I only received a few of each. Corn is a staple of the garden, especially in a survival situation. Corn is cheap there is no reason to include so few seeds.
customer_reviews.author: Rie

customer_reviews.title: Missing items
customer_reviews.text: As others have said, it’s missing varieties listed. I’m assuming maybe they’re running low due to COVID? Of the 40 listed, I did not get the bush beans, broccoli, Brussels sprouts, red acre cabbage,celery, collards, kale,yolo wonder peppers, pumpkins, cherry bell radish, spinach or squash. So 13/40. Thanks for all the catnip though
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Ok seeds, some came up, some did not. Not the best mix.
customer_reviews.text: Some of the seeds have not come up. Larger seeds like watermelon or pumpkin were very few in the package (maybe 5-7 seeds). Also did not like the mix of them - I had 5 kinds of lettuce with lots of seeds in each packet and only one kind of watermelon with like 5 seeds in the packet.
customer_reviews.author: Nailya

customer_reviews.title: Good seeds
customer_reviews.text: Everything I planted is sprouting, in egg cartons. The Only issue is, the stickers on the little packages did not stay on, so I don't know what they are. :(
customer_reviews.author: T. L. Hoyt

customer_reviews.title: and everything I have started to date is coming up beautifully! I would recommend getting several of these because ...
customer_reviews.text: They did everything they advertised and they did it quickly, and everything I have started to date is coming up beautifully! I would recommend getting several of these because they have gone the extra mile in sealing these seeds for long term storage, so not only do you need some for growing, I cannot think of a better plan than to have one package of these seeds stored back unopened as part of an emergency survival plan. I am not disappointed and I don't think you will be either.
customer_reviews.author: Ed M.

customer_reviews.title: Excellent value!
customer_reviews.text: This seed packet is extensive and an incredible investment! I only have a small garden at this time, but if stored properly these seeds should be viable for many years. I am very excited about growing from seed for the first time (previously I've purchased started plants from local home stores). The seeds are stored well in individual (and labeled) light-proof packets and then in a large light-proof packet. Inside is a set of cards with recommendations for germination periods/temps, ect. I'd highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Jessica

customer_reviews.title: Great results!
customer_reviews.text: So far, so good! Many of my tomato, squash and cucumber seeds germinated nicely. I'll be planting a few more next week! 6/12 UPDATE Added a few more pictures. Growing strong. Already have cucumbers!
customer_reviews.author: MadamTM

customer_reviews.title: I don’t believe there’s 16,500 seeds
customer_reviews.text: I find it hard to believe there are 16,500 seeds in this pack. The seed packets are tiny, but there is an awesome variety. It contained the right number of packets but some were different versions than what was listed. I got giant pumpkin seeds (2 seeds in the pack?!) instead of sweet pumpkins and regular boring summer squash, instead of purple squash. I will see how these grow in a few weeks - I hope both pumpkin seeds sprout 😒
customer_reviews.author: Moi!

customer_reviews.title: Excellent germination rate. Great value!
customer_reviews.text: I've seen some negative reviews about these seeds and want to say that we had a 95% germination rate and are very happy with quality of the seeds and the variety. I knew when I purchased that it was a very popular time for seeds and so I might get some substitutions but that's ok with me. All seed suppliers were overwhelmed by demand during the beginning of the pandemic. This is an extraordinary value for the money. I would definitely purchase again.
customer_reviews.author: ConstantGardener

customer_reviews.title: Sucks
customer_reviews.text: The packaging is okay, very hard to open...but none of the seeds have germinated....sad product....even tried placing them in a little water first....after opening the corn and beans and they didn’t grow...it caused me to open the rest....don’t waste your money....I have a super green thumb....if I can’t make it grow or bring it back to life...it’s a lost cause...and these are a waste.....
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Fast Delivery
customer_reviews.text: This came faster than expected...... I know with everything going on w/ Covid that shipments has been slow w/ everyone but I was pleased that this came in a great amount of time & is exactly as pictured..... I just wanted to update & show amazing these seeds are..... My veggies are growing beautifully & wonderful!!!! Thank you again for my seeds...... I am soooooo excited!!!!
customer_reviews.author: MsBossLadii

customer_reviews.title: Many things are incorrect
customer_reviews.text: I bought two of the bags, they were both the same, not good. 1. The list that is on the bag is not correct. For example, they said that there were 2 kinds of tomatoes. Nope, there was only one in both bags. 2. Both bags were incorrect and missing some of what they said was in the bags and there were in both bags one pack of seeds with no name. No clue what they are. 3. I'm now certain that many of the seeds were incorrectly named. The attached image is supposed to be asparagus. That is a huge no. Maybe broccoli but I'm not sure.
customer_reviews.author: Mary Jackson

customer_reviews.title: Good variety; poor germination
customer_reviews.text: Although enough seeds germinated to grow a vegetable garden more than half didn't grow - even in premium potting soil as a starter. None of the melons grew at all. I saved seeds from the few plants (especially lettuce) that grew and hope to have a decent garden with the seedlings from them this year.
customer_reviews.author: cschust

customer_reviews.title: Bought for the emergency store room... but ...
customer_reviews.text: Bought for the emergency store room...but I always prefer to test product directly to make sure it will perform as expected, so we planted quite a number of these in the garden this year. All are coming up well. Make sure to also have a pack of wildflower seeds to plant nearby and attract pollinators..
customer_reviews.author: Robert P.

customer_reviews.title: Amazing!!!
customer_reviews.text: Soo happy with these seeds!!! The yield was amazing! I have a first year garden and started with seed! I still have a ton of seeds left and look forward to planting again next year!!! I would buy from them again in a heartbeat!
customer_reviews.author: Rita

customer_reviews.title: Really good!
customer_reviews.text: Just arrived and has no doubles for me. A great variety of seeds and all are labeled and fine. I'll be getting these ready to grow soon. I'll update if they have problems but so far I've had no problems like others of duplicates or missing seeds.
customer_reviews.author: Lesa Sweat

customer_reviews.title: A good kit, but no way it includes 16,000 seeds
customer_reviews.text: I thought this package would have been larger with the claim of 16,000 seeds. Maybe a 1,000 seeds at most were found in the packets. I encountered two packages that had no seeds in them at all. But, I will give it to the seller that 50% of the seeds planted in germination pods actually grew into plants.
customer_reviews.author: Matt Torch

customer_reviews.title: Great seeds!!
customer_reviews.text: Picked up a new hobby during isolation. Had zero expectations as I am a super beginner gardener. I even over planted assuming I was not going to be successful. Happy I’m wrong! So many veggies germinated and are going bonkers :)
customer_reviews.author: Rion Foster

customer_reviews.title: Good seed packets but difficult to handle and needs quality control
customer_reviews.text: Good seed packet but needs quality control. I got the booklet but did not get the little snips. Not a big deal but for some people it may be frustrating. The seed packets are very tiny like the foil pouches that come in ramen soup so they are a little hard to handle. I cut them with a razor blade and stapled them back together to save them but it was sort of a hassle. For the price though it is not bad and I will probably order again.
customer_reviews.author: Yolanda

customer_reviews.title: Really disappointing
customer_reviews.text: I received only 39 packets and many of them were simply multiple packets of the same seed. Nearly the entire bag was different varieties or completely different plants than advertised, which shut me out from even attempting to grow because of my climate zone. The ones I was able to attempt had a terrible germination rate. When I attempted to come to a solution with the shop, I was ignored—which is a shame because I ordered long before there was any kind of warning posted about Covid-related substitutes.
customer_reviews.author: Amber Hollister

customer_reviews.title: These say 95% germination rate. I will verify this is TRUE.
customer_reviews.text: I am going to have myself a mini-farm in no time. I am having fun with these. They are nicely packaged in little labeled zip lock bags. I cannot believe how fast they came up and how thick. I would say you do not need to plant too many seeds in each starting cup because they all germinate. You get a lot of great varieties and a lot of seeds in each packet. I believe you would pay about $100.00 if you bought individual packets at $2.49 each.
customer_reviews.author: Ken M.

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: I just got mine open and realized I had 4 pea and other multiple baggies lacking other items listed and only got 22 different types. Not near the 40 I expected. Semi disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Emmamcgee

customer_reviews.title: Great variety of seeds
customer_reviews.text: I love that these are Heirloom and not GMO. Can't wait to watch them grow
customer_reviews.author: Oran Belgrave877888

customer_reviews.title: Great Germination Rate!
customer_reviews.text: These seeds have done great for me. Everything I have planted thus far for the spring, summer, and fall harvests have germinated wonderfully and quickly, and stuff that's already done for the season did well from start to finish. So far I've done the zucchini, butter lettuce, spinach, swiss chard, carrots, brussel sprouts, and beets. No complaints here. These seeds appear to be of excellent quality. Store in the fridge crisper to maximize shelf life.
customer_reviews.author: Alma

customer_reviews.title: Happy first time gardener, great germination rate
customer_reviews.text: Planted my garden in July so had to do a fall garden. The kit had almost all of the veggies suitable for fall gardens in the NW, and by the end of August my garden was looking full and beautiful. Everything I planted-- diff types of lettuce, romaine, spinach, cabbage, turnips, rutabega, peas, radishes, green onions, cauliflower-- grew amazingly. Only 1 veggie, broccoli, didn't come up at all. For my first garden/ not having a ton of experience I was super impressed w these seeds. Can't wait to try the rest of the veggies in the spring!
customer_reviews.author: Sarah Caulk

customer_reviews.title: plants in a bag
customer_reviews.text: I received the bag and my expectations were high but I was slightly disappointed. I thought the seeds would grow better and have a plush area of new plants. Half never came up and I won't be buying again.
customer_reviews.author: World Cru

customer_reviews.title: the seller actually called me back when i has a problem.
customer_reviews.text: I posted that the seller made a mistake. It was actually the post office in error. would by again.
customer_reviews.author: Lloyd Hill

customer_reviews.title: Didn’t work well
customer_reviews.text: The package came in nicely and looked nice. However, we haven’t been able to get any of the seeds to grow.
customer_reviews.author: Karen

customer_reviews.title: Would not order again...bait and switch
customer_reviews.text: Was disappointed that many of the seeds listed on the package were not included in my order while other strains I received doubles of ☹️
customer_reviews.author: steve whitman

customer_reviews.title: Good for a beginner gardener.
customer_reviews.text: Pros -Good germination rates. -Great assortment of seeds for the price. I typically pay $3 to $10 for one packet of seeds from traditional seed companies. Cons -A couple of seed packs did not match up with what was printed on the bag. -This is not something that I would purchase for Intermediate and Advanced gardeners.
customer_reviews.author: Kristopher J Sung

customer_reviews.title: Low germination rate on most seeds
customer_reviews.text: Not very many seeds grew out of these seeds have 50 percent burpee hase near 100 percent wish I could return but it's to late now that I am trying to grow these
customer_reviews.author: Tom m

customer_reviews.title: so so, so far
customer_reviews.text: Came a lot later than anticipated and was missing some of the seeds promised in the kit (really bummed about the spinach as that was the first one I went to plant and I didn’t have it). Otherwise good variety and starting to grow them now. Can update once things start going.
customer_reviews.author: Jimena Chavez

customer_reviews.title: Seed count very short!
customer_reviews.text: While this seems like a great deal, I have found that it is really short on what they say The seed Count should beshould be I even found a cantaloupe package that was empty. There were others that were very short on the count
customer_reviews.author: Connie Joyner

customer_reviews.title: Waste of money and time
customer_reviews.text: I've had to replant because seeds aren't germinating. Waste of money and time.
customer_reviews.author: Mark

customer_reviews.title: So far, so good...
customer_reviews.text: I've already started planting the seeds that are recommended to start indoors in a hydroponic system (Aerogarden). As directed or as research suggested, I put 3 in each grow sponge and to my amazement ALL OF THE SEEDS SPROUTED after just a week! (The photo is after just over 2) As exciting as that sounds it was a big mistake because the roots of each seedling grew into the sponges, so transplanting them separately was difficult and I may have caused them shock. I will check back after starting the outdoor seeding.
customer_reviews.author: Jay deLovely

customer_reviews.title: Thanks
customer_reviews.text: I bought my first purchase of these seeds to practice building up my green thumb. I have progressed very much using this pack of seeds and I recommend anyone trying to do the same do so as well. My second purchase was for my brother to practice building his skills as well. Also it is great for any peppers who want to grow their own food somewhere down the road, seeds in package stay good for a long time.
customer_reviews.author: cory

customer_reviews.title: Not growing.. Nothing at all? :(
customer_reviews.text: Nothing is growing so far?? I had them in cups and its been two weeks!/something should've happened by now?? :( disappointed.. Truly. I been growing veggies for 25+ yrs!.. Could you replace with fresh seeds package says they are out date?
customer_reviews.author: Melissa E.

customer_reviews.title: Good germination
customer_reviews.text: I haven't gotten to the point where I can eat any of these, but I have gotten several tomato germinations. They seem to be healthy, so I'm assuming the rest are the same. definitely a good pick for the apocalypse prepper. UPDATE: I have planted several different types of these seeds, including the corn, squash, tomato, beans, and others. It is early, but i believe I have gotten 100% germination. With minimal effort in a raised bed. This is an awesome seed pack. More updates coming.
customer_reviews.author: B wake

customer_reviews.title: Awesome deal!
customer_reviews.text: Awesome deal! I got everything described and even got an extra pack of celery seeds! I plan to plant some of these in the fall. I will update my review then. The only variation that I saw is the pumpkin variety I got (big max) doesn’t match the label on my bag (sweet sugar). The are very different! If you are getting this whole set with your heart set on a particular variety be careful! Expect slight variations in varieties!!
customer_reviews.author: GretchyTop Contributor: Aquascaping

customer_reviews.title: Buy two use one now save one
customer_reviews.text: Problem is I bought these for storage. I am buying another pack to see how they grow this spring. Problem with prepping. Don’t know until u need and then no returns
customer_reviews.author: lynn angell

customer_reviews.title: Great deal
customer_reviews.text: Impressed at the germination rate - planted peppers, lettuce, tomatoes, eggplant, rhubarb, pumpkin, watermelon, summer squash, sunflowers, peas, radishes, cucumbers, and more with fast, happy, hardy seedlings. Only about 10 days since planting so can't say what the yield will be but this was a fantastic price for such a great variety of seeds.
customer_reviews.author: Linds

customer_reviews.title: Orders backed up for a reason!
customer_reviews.text: Customer service from this business is amazing. When I had concerns about where my package was, they were very helpful in explaining the mass amount of orders they’re putting out right now. The product was worth the wait.. there were 40 packets of seeds, even if they were out of a certain type they made up for it with extra of something else which I thought was great. I’m very excited about seeing these seeds grow! Such a great variety of fruits and vegetables and herbs!
customer_reviews.author: Katie

customer_reviews.title: Smaller plastic packets. Just planted a few things and ...
customer_reviews.text: Smaller plastic packets. Just planted a few things and already seeing growth. Wish the seed packets had a ziplock top so they can be closed back up, since I didnt use all of the seeds in one planting.
customer_reviews.author: LisaMarie

customer_reviews.title: God bless those who grow and sell Non-GMO seeds...Thank you❤
customer_reviews.text: Ordered these and received them the very next day, Thank you. I have been watching this listing for about a year. I have not planted anything yet as it is Oct 2020, but I look forward to a wonderful garden. Love the packaging, instructions and the variety. I am glad they are NON - GMO and Heirloom. I am sick of Monsanto and what they have done to our food industry...not to mention all the poison Monsanto left behind in Fort McClellan and Anniston Georgia. God bless everyone who is actually selling and planting Non-GMO Heirloom seeds.
customer_reviews.author: YMM

customer_reviews.title: I only just got them but was excited to read ...
customer_reviews.text: I only just got them but was excited to read instructions that SHOULD have been included. So, much for that. So, I have to guess or search each seed to see what I am supposed to do with it. You'd think they would remember to put them in since it says it on the package. Guess I update when/if I figure it out.
customer_reviews.author: Anath

customer_reviews.title: Bought for my Food supply
customer_reviews.text: I am very happy great variety and perfect for a food supply. I am growing everything in small spaces having great results here in Northern California. The sprout rate may be as high as 95% great plants and hardy. I am two months from planting and I have now harvested radish that grew very fast, romain lettuces, and kale. Spinach will be soon ready for harvest as well as the Georgia collards. I highly recommend these seeds to anyone who wants to grow their own food.
customer_reviews.author: Alex

customer_reviews.title: Missing varieties
customer_reviews.text: Did not receive some of the seeds listed on package and duplicates of others. Some varieties do no grow.
customer_reviews.author: Rodney T.

customer_reviews.title: Good assortment, seeds are sprouting
customer_reviews.text: I received this from dear hubby as a Christmas gift, a kind of just in case seed vault thing. Then 2020 happened and we remembered that we had this. It has a really good seed assortment that works for our zone. All the seeds that I have planned except one have sprouted and look pretty healthy. There were enough seeds that I was able to share with a friend. Overall a really great purchase.
customer_reviews.author: racheal salas

customer_reviews.title: Great variety and great price. Everything sprouted
customer_reviews.text: A great variety for this year's victory garden. At least a few of every type has sprouted for me. The picture posted is after one month in the raised bed. Peppers seemed slow to sprout and asparagus was the last to show itself. Had fun planting this with my 4 and 2 year old, they pushed the Bigger seeds in the ground, yesterday we had some tasty arugula and lettuce. The small baggies are labeled nicely but it's smart to have a tape dispenser when planting to immediately seal them back up if not using them all at once. Happy planting
customer_reviews.author: Harvestsmiles

customer_reviews.title: Grow cards wrong.
customer_reviews.text: Good packaging but the grow cards it came with were wrong - supposed to be three that covered all the seeds but was just two and a duplicate of one of the two.
customer_reviews.author: Sam Seed

customer_reviews.title: Good price, not suitable for South Texas, all the plants died before harvest.
customer_reviews.text: A lot of seeds for the price, but here is south Texas, all the plants died even though I watered them. I tried a fall planting and a early spring planting and almost all of the plants died.
customer_reviews.author: Oon Suan

customer_reviews.title: Great product and a good addition to your families contingency plan
customer_reviews.text: Quick delivery and great value. I purchased as a fail-safe for my family and have these stored in my freezer. Most seeds will last a minimum of 5 years at room temperature if stored correctly and in the freezer certain hardy varieties can last better than 20 years.
customer_reviews.author: David V.

customer_reviews.title: 16,500 Non GMO Heirloom Vegetable Seeds
customer_reviews.text: I had great luck germinating these seeds indoors. Each small packet is individually labeled which is nice. I used the included directions mostly to determine how deep to plant each variety. I used regular soil and made sure to keep it fairly wet while the seeds were germinating. Once they pop up above ground you still want to keep them pretty wet when they are small since they don't have big roots established and can dry out fast! Once they get a little bit larger and have roots then you can let the soil dry out a little in between watering to avoid mold/rot.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great Deal.
customer_reviews.text: Most of the seeds germinated and I have been having great vegetable growth. They did not include 2 of the seed packets they were supposed to, the one I was mainly sad about was the missing watermelon seeds, however I never asked the company for a correction which is why I only removed 1 star. If only 5 of the seed packets had germinated it would have paid for itself, and I had 13 packets germinate and I didn’t even plant half of the vegetables available.
customer_reviews.author: Reader

customer_reviews.title: Ok but not for an avid gardener
customer_reviews.text: Not many seeds of any one species and not very specific directions. Also, some of the seeds need to be started indoors which is not mentioned anywhere in the description or directions. All in all, these seeds are OK if you're expecting Armageddon and think you'll survive a year or two to get a garden started. This also might be good for a novice hobbyist.
customer_reviews.author: CR

customer_reviews.title: Birthday Prepper Gift
customer_reviews.text: Birthday Prepper gift for my wife . . .She is an avid gardener . . .This was a good gift
customer_reviews.author: Roy P.

customer_reviews.title: Good selection of seeds
customer_reviews.text: This is a good selection of seeds that are packaged well, received six cheap plastic garden markers and not the clippers that are in the description.
customer_reviews.author: Glen E ThomasTop Contributor: Camping

customer_reviews.title: Great kit
customer_reviews.text: First thing to note is that the only reason I didn't give it five stars is that I got 39 out of 40. I did get 40 packs but it seems the asparagus was duplicated and I didn't get any arugula. The packaging is nice as is the booklet and I love the little clippers. It's an excellent starter kit and although I haven't planted all 39 (I don't have enough yard space!). I did the tomatoes, lettuce and peppers and they all had a good germination rate. The only type that hasn't germinated for me is the snowball cauliflower but I will give some of those seeds another try. Looking forward to doing the melons next.
customer_reviews.author: Christine L.

customer_reviews.title: Very High Germination Rate
customer_reviews.text: Very high germination rate for the lettuce seeds I planted this fall: paperwork states 85% rate but most if not all the seeds sprouted. I keep the rest of the seeds in freezer for future growing seasons.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: This was a great bundle to purchase
customer_reviews.text: I have a larger variety this year in my vegetable garden because of this pack. I still have alot of seeds left over. Great for the person just wanting a little of everything.
customer_reviews.author: S

customer_reviews.title: Nice variety
customer_reviews.text: I have purchased this item, packaging is perfect, variety is good, the only thing is that it says 40 but I have received 38 only, other than that can’t wait to start planting them!
customer_reviews.author: Monireh

customer_reviews.title: Great Packaging
customer_reviews.text: Seeds came today. Exactly as described. Took about 6 days to receive. Packaging is nice. Appears other reviewers problem of labels falling off seed packages has been resolved as all individual package labels are printed on. Outside package is resealable, individual seed packages are not. Planting instructions are included. Can't wait to plant them!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Terrific products!
customer_reviews.text: Just got my heirloom vegetable seeds today! I’m excited to start planting these seeds. Products are as described. Comes with planting instructions for all seeds that are included in the package. And a free gift as well.
customer_reviews.author: Momby

customer_reviews.title: Started My Nursery!
customer_reviews.text: I have had amazing resulting with the seeds - about a 93% propagation rate. I start most of the larger seeds using damp paper towels, while the smaller seeds went straight into the soil. Learn how to make cuttings / clones, use only HALF of your seeds - and you’ll never need to plant again. :) First generation plants always have a richer taste, and second generation clones are perfect for reselling!
customer_reviews.author: Kinetic Web Design

customer_reviews.title: Broken bags..
customer_reviews.text: A bunch of my bags were broken open.. there were seeds all in the bottom of the main bag..
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: sometimes they work when they want to. Plants grow very big!
customer_reviews.text: tried it my way got the highway. The seeds are too dry to function, need to plant them specifically on the date labeled for each one. It was fun to see if I could grow anything but I came up short. edit:1 I did the paper towel method and the seeds have germinated in just 3 days! I will continue to update as I go along for this product takes time.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Missing seeds but pretty good overall
customer_reviews.text: It is a good seed pack with a wide variety of seeds, but the seeds are not in resealable containers and I was missing a few of the types of seeds. My pack was missing the "yolo wonder pepper" among a few others.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Heirloom seeds for prepper supplies
customer_reviews.text: I don't plan to use these seeds. I put them in my prepper gear and if there is ever a need to grow veggies during hard times, I'll be able to harvest the seeds for regrowing next time.
customer_reviews.author: PKVeazey

customer_reviews.title: Good value, good yield
customer_reviews.text: Everything we planted came up! The instruction book was easy to follow and helpful for first year gardeners. The only thing we’ve eaten so far is the lettuce and it tasted well... like lettuce... so I guess that’s a good thing haha!
customer_reviews.author: Steph

customer_reviews.title: So far so good!
customer_reviews.text: I just started the seeds a couple days ago and they are already coming up!!
customer_reviews.author: Valerie L. Bequette

customer_reviews.title: Misleading photo and description...
customer_reviews.text: Ordered these seeds as they were advertised and shown in photo as 16,500, only to get my package today and there is actually only 7000+ in the package. That's less then half of the photo and description that states 16,500??
customer_reviews.author: Holly

customer_reviews.title: Great Variety!
customer_reviews.text: Loved that it has scissors to open packages and the book that explains when and how to grow them. Good variety of seeds too BUT would rather have tweezers instead of scissors included because there are a lot of small seeds and it's hard to get just a few. Overall fantastic!
customer_reviews.author: Ejensen3

customer_reviews.title: Great bang for your buck!
customer_reviews.text: Some of the seeds are not germinating but that could be due to the zone I'm in because all of the rest of them are shooting right up. They are so beautifull and I cant wait untill I can get them outside in the ground. Most of them grew so fast! The seed guide was super helpful and insightfull especially for a first time garderner like myself.
customer_reviews.author: Ariel Kidder

product_meta.title: 16,500 Non GMO Heirloom Vegetable Seeds Survival Garden 40 Variety Pack
product_meta.description:
Size:Original version*** Important COVID 19 INFORMATION : Please read before odering ****
Please check and agree to the delivery date listed on the purchase order before ordering.
Please understad there could be further delays if there are coninued quarantine layoffs with FEDEX, USPS or any of our other providers.
Please Understand that we will require up to 7 business days to process refunds and exchanges during this time.
Please understand strains on the label on the front of the package does not match the 40 strains that are inside since we have to substitue strains

(You will receive a variety of 40 different vegetable garden seeds from the list below)
We cannot take strain requests due to the correct volume and market scarcity. 
American flag leek
Arugula
Bean(Blue lake Bush, Ford Hook Lima)
Beet, Detroit
Brussels sprouts
Cabbage(Golden Acres, Red Acre, Dutch)
Cantaloupe, Hale's
Carrots(Chantenay, Scarlet Nantes)
Chives
Corn(Jimmy Red, Bodacious, Bilicious)
Cucumber(Ashley,Boston Pickling)
Dill bouquet
Eggplant, Black Beauty
Endive, Black Eye
Kale
Lettuce(Bibb, Iceberg, Mignonette, Butercrunch, Paris Island)
Oregano
Parsley
Pea, Green Arrow
Pepper(Chili, Anaheim, Ancho, Cayenne,Bannana, Hungarian, Jalapeno, Habanero, Purple beauty
Pumpkin(Big Max, Sugar, Green Stripe, Connecticut)
Radish, Cherry Bell
Rhubarb, Victoria
Rutabaga 
Spinach(New Zealand, Noble)
Squash(zucchin, Black beauty)
Swiss Chard
Tomato(Ace 55, Purple Beauty, Roma, Jubilee, Red Cherry)
Turnip
Watermelon , Crimson Sweet
We will try to only give you 1 type of each with lettuce being the only strain you will likely receive 2 or 3. You will receive an average of 1 gram per strain.(Less for tomato,pepper & more for corn and beans ect) Link to Digital instruction book will be included.
